item.title: Southeastern Fishes Council 44th (2018) Annual Meeting Presentation
item.description: Southeastern Fishes Council 44th (2018) Annual Meeting Presentation You can download the Microsoft Power Point version of this presentation from ResearchGate (link). Also, don’t forget to follow the Southern Brook Lamprey project log on ResearchGate (link).

item.title: Assessing Viability of Passive Integrated Transponder (PIT) Tags for Ecological Studies of Lamprey Ammocoetes
item.description: Passive integrated transponder (PIT) tags are widely used to study movement and habitat preferences in large-bodied fish species. However, relatively large tag sizes have traditionally limited their suitability for small-bodied fishes. Technological advances have recently led to the production of smaller PIT tags (8.0 x 1.4 mm) that may prove useful to the study of small-bodied fish species, particularly those of conservation importance. Southern Brook Lamprey (Ichthyomyzon gagei) are small-bodied, filiform fish.
